intro: Acer pensylvanicum subsp. parviflorum, commonly known as the red maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its vibrant red foliage in autumn, which makes it a popular ornamental species. The plant has opposite, palmately lobed leaves that turn bright red or orange in the fall. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring before the leaves emerge. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–25 meters and prefers moist, well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade.
